answers.answer: Hi, if medical therapy fails, cardiac transplantation is recommended for all eligible patients with an LVEF below 20%  regardless of clinical symptoms. It is difficult to predict the exact prognosis, as this depends on other co morbid conditions like diabetes and hypertension and the cause for the low ejection fraction values. Patients with LVEF of 10% heart failure have a 5-year mortality rate approaching 50 percent in some studies. Regards.

With an EF of just 10% he must be very weak. He needs the right medications and as stated above, he should be on a transplant list. How did his heart get into that condition? can you supply some history?I think it is wise to have an ICD fitted as soon as possible.
From my understanding, you seem to be asking what can be done for him at home, but this is not something practical. He needs professional help.
